snippet: New findings about birds’ olfactory powers add to evidence that many animals signal their alarm with scent.
abstract: Dr Deseada Parejo study published in journal Biology Letters shows that Eurasian rollers, a species of bird, are able to detect the smell of fear in their young and that the smell causes parent birds to react with heightened caution; finding adds to evidence collected by scientific researchers showing that many animals signal their alarm with scent.
lead_paragraph: New findings about birds’ olfactory powers add to evidence that many animals signal their alarm with scent.

headline.print_headline: The Smell of Fear (No Tweets Necessary)
headline.seo: For Birds Whose Odor Conveys Fear, No Tweets Necessary
headline.main: The Smell of Fear (No Tweets Necessary)
